intro: Hieracium subelatiforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium subelatiforme is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soils.
